Their behaviour was bad, i repeat their "BEHAVIOUR" was "BAD". We wanted some change as we gave all of our "khuchra" tk at the time of order. But they didn't even have the courtesy to say politely that they didn't have any change, it was like we were beggars asking them for money. We ordered both chicken and beef, the amount of chicken was really poor, it was really a fancy cheese version of typical local pizza. So don't get confused by the price.,1.0,;

Their pizzas are just average. But behavior is quite extra ordinarily "POOR" we ordered 4 pizzas costing about 860. We paid them with 100 taka notes. But later on we wanted to give a 500 taka note instead of those 100 taka notes because it was urgent to have some changes. But, man o man they were like, "who are you?" even after explaining the incident the guy who was taking order didn't have the conscience to even say sorry. Frustrated with the behavior!!!!,1.0,;

But we were 7/8 sitting in the table. when we asked for more glass they gave us dirty glasses and that also after waiting for 5 minutes. And when we asked for the manager they didn't even pay any attention. Even though we were sitting just before the cash counter. If you want to have tasty biriyani and want to feel helpless. you are most welcome.

Review Text: Quality of food - 3/5 Presentation - 4/5 Authenticity/Originality of food (Srilankan Cuisine) - 2/5 Taste - 2/5 (used to be better) Price (value for food) - 1/5... Kottu Roti - very good Yellow Rice - averate Chicken red curry - not near to srilankan style cyrry which i had at srilanka. It was more like Bangla style. Beef Nugamba or something (cant remember the name) - same as chicken curry. Although a bit different but doesn't have any srilankan touch. Moju - very good. The food was over priced....n the taste was not even near to my expectations.Service good
3 of us attended for lunch. The decor was minimalist but clean. The waiters were pleasant but need proper training. As this is a new cuisine for most of us
Review: we had to ask for recommendations. This was not voluntarily offered. Even after we advised them of our lack of knowledge about Sri Lankan food. The waiter appeared to suggest the most expensive dishes as opposed dishes that we'd like considering we were describing what we were in the mood for. Ordering the food was a chal...lenge. We ordered a set menu they had available as this would provide the most selection. We also ordered parathas
Recommends;: egg hoppers and a beef curry. The waiters did not make suggestions that we'd need to order this additional food but it was essential for a full meal. It took over 20 minutes for the food to arrive. Once it did
column4: I admit it was tasty but most of it was very spicy. We were not aware of this. We can handle spice but we still would've appreciated the waiters making us aware of it. The staff mentioned 3/4 of our way through the meal that we had two drinks which came with the set menu that we'd ordered. Whether this was done to make us order more drinks or whether the waiters forgot....both are unattractive. The set menu was priced in a manner I would say appropriate but the curry was overpriced. It cost just under 4000tk for 3 of us and in all consideration
column5: this was a tad over what we would've felt was appropriate. I hope the suggestions are considered thoughtfully. I enjoyed the food so we shall be back
column6: inshallah.

Review Text: Poor service. Pathetic staff and manager.

Yesterday's azan was at 6.46 PM. The restaurant had served tang and iced tea beforehand. After the azan, everyone around us had food, except 3 tables. I figured they'd be 4/5 mins late. But nope, we waited there till 7.05 PM and got no food, while there was a table of around 15 people who'd received their second servings by that time. One time, a waiter came to our table with food, we got really excited because we'd been somewhat fasting for an extra 15 minutes, but then the ...waiter went back because that food wasn't for our table; such a tease, innit. At around 7 PM while everyone there was eating their fish and chips and we were sitting with our glass of iced tea, they brought us some really unappetizing, complementary soup. I lost it at that point and asked why they are seating people if they can't make enough food. To which they replied "Amra chai na kono customer mon kharap koruk." Bro you aren't serving people food for iftar, I think that's enough for me to "mon kharap." So then we left the place, as soon as we get on the lift they say "Apnader food chole ashche." As if I'm ever going back. We went to BFC and had super wholesome fried chicken. No ragrets, but f u, The Manhattan FISH MARKET Bangladesh. There was more weird shit before this, of course. I'd asked on Facebook whether or not the restaurant takes reservations, and they'd replied that they don't have any booking system in their outlets. They said that they serve people on a "first come, first serve" basis so it'd be best if we show up at least 45 minutes before iftar. I called the number given on your Facebook page and website again today at around 3 pm to check if you really don't take bookings. The cellphone was switched off. So we went to the Dhanmondi outlet at 5 PM today, and they told us they couldn't seat two people because all seats were booked. I told them that whoever manages their social media doesn't know that they take bookings, and if I show up at 5 at a virtually empty restaurant that serves iftar "first come, first get," then I should get a table. Then they found us a table, lol. They took our order for an iftar platter at around 6 pm. After 15 minutes or so, they came to confirm it, and their receipt had the items "garlic mussels, water" whereas we'd ordered fish and chips and chicken tenders. We told them that they'd taken a completely wrong order for some reason. I mean, I'd understand if they'd thought we ordered grilled fish instead of fried, but mussels???? What??? But then we got no food at all because MUSSELS KHAIBI NA TOH MANHATTAN FISH MARKET AISOS KEN,1.0,;
The best sea food seller and passionate to serve emotionally in the region. just fell in love with their great service.

This was my first visit to MFM and my experience was awful. I ordered chicken mussels calamari and for drinks I ordered sunset by the bay and lemongrass cooler. The drinks were so disgusting that we both could not take the second sip of those. The drinks were smelling like cockroach and cough syrup and the chicken was smelly too. The spice in the mussels was not good at all. The only good thing was the fries. I would not recommend this place for anything. We ordered coleslaw which was not served and thank God for that. We had some issues with the bill as well. They should improve the sincerity to their customers.

Don't miss out on their chowder of the day.

Review Text: Last food experience was horrible! I was craving for chicken cashew nut salad & thus ordered this from them
Review: along with a set menu via Hungrynaki. The cashew nut salad which they provide with their set menu is completely different from that of the individual dish. I haven't
column4: tasted such disgusting chicken cashew nut salad. It smells like beguni & pakora. They fry extemely thin & mini slices of chicken
column5: (almost invisible)
column6: by covering them up with a huge amount of ...besan & flour which is responsible for this weird smell. There was abnormal thick coating in each of the chicken slices. The cashew nut salad which they provide with the set menu atleast contains capicum slices but the individual dish contains onions & cucumber only! Horrible...horrible experience. My craving was being killed by their food & I literally threw it away. They should & must stop cheating people by coating up their meat pieces with unnecessary amount of besan & flour to make them look bigger. I had the same experience with one of their beef items. The quality of their wrapped prawns has deteriorated too. There is too much of noodles & the prawns are incredibly thin & small. & the dish is too try but previously their wrapped prawns were juicy. I used to order from them a lot via Hungrynaki but the last time made me too disappointed with the quality of their dishes & have decided not to order from them anymore since you get only fried besan & flour.

Review Text: Awsome food!â™¥â™¥â™¥ Testy foos!â™¥â™¥â™¥

Tune & Bite Music Cafe Khilgaon is one of the most popular places to hang out in the Heart of Dhaka for all types of party lovers. This is an ideal place to hang out with Friends or passing a good time with Family Members. They has Distinct Seating Areas including a live music court. The eye-catching lounge is perfectly built friend gatherings or every types of family programs . It is the epitome of class and elegance
Review: with interiors adorned by famous singers photo and maxim.... Interiors are superfluous with best rolling Stone magazines cover backdrop
Recommends;: the kitchen is really hygienic and the washrooms are neat and clean. In one word
column4: the space is just beautiful. The menu has different types of delicious food items. They provide their best services to make you feel wow by yammi food with music. They always offer some of the best dishes from its affordable and budget-friendly menu. Best value proposition according to the price of Food. Some time they throw offers for discount over dishes. If you are lucky enough
column5: you can avail those. Staffs are very much friendly and well mannered. Besides
column6: the owner is also very polite
column7: cordial and helpful minded. As there plays a lot of live music so it helps to create a groove atmosphere. They have the best studio and audio system for live music. Nice collection of Music can make anyone fan of this restaurant. Overall this is an awesome place amongst youngsters and people who want to experience the nightlife with live music and special menu. All this benefits has made this restaurant extraordinary and worthwhile visit for everyone.
